member.name: M:Microsoft.Graph.Communications.Calls.CommunicationsClientExtensions.Calls(Microsoft.Graph.Communications.Client.ICommunicationsClient,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the call collection. This is the main entry point for the calling SDK. The return value of this function can be cached by the clients as required.
member.param: If set to true the resulting will hold all instances it creates unless explicitly deleted (either by the service or by the developer). If set to false no generated by the or its children will be stored by the , instead it is the developers responsibility to control the lifetime of the generated instances.
member.returns: The root singleton node. Multiple invocations of this method will return the same .

member.summary: Answers a call with locally hosted media configuration.

The optional callback uri. Specifying this will override the default callback uri set when creating the
The scenario identitifer. This parameter should be used for tracking scenarios across multiple calls. Automatically generated by the SDK if not provided.
member.returns: The that completes after the request has been sent. This does not guarantee that the call has been answered. Any updates on call will be delivered via notification and can be observed using ICall.OnUpdated

member.summary: Invite a participant into the existing call.
member.param: The participant collection into which a new participant is being invited.
The identity set of the invited participant.
The replaces call identifier. This is an optional field used for consultative transfer. This is used to bring a participant from an existing call.
member.returns: The that completes after the request has been sent. This does not guarantee that the participant has joined. Any updates on the participant collection will be delivered via notification and can be observed using IParticipantCollection.OnUpdated

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graph.Communications.Calls.ICall.PlayPromptAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Graph.MediaPrompt},System.Action,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Plays the specified media prompts.
member.param: A callback indicating when the prompts have been queued, but have not yet completed playing.
member.returns: The with information on how the play operation completed.
member.exception: An error has occurred when playing the prompt.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graph.Communications.Calls.ICall.CancelMediaProcessingAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Performs the CancelMediaProcessing operation. This cancels all or one of the ongoing media operations.
member.remarks: Media operations refer to the IVR operations PlayPrompt and RecordResponse, which are by default queued to process in order. CancelMediaProcessing cancels any operation that is in-processed as well as operations that are queued. For example, this can be used to clean up the IVR operation queue for a new media operation. However, this will not cancel a SubscribeToTone operation since it operates independent of any operation queue.
member.returns:
The that completes after the request has been sent.
Canceling the media processing here will be reflected by a failure in the specific operation (PlayPromptAsync, etc).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graph.Communications.Calls.ICall.SubscribeToToneAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Subscribe to DTMF (dual-tone multi-frequency signaling). This allows you to be notified when the user presses keys on a "touchtone" phone.
member.returns:
The that completes after the request has been sent.
The DTMF notifications will come on ICall.OnUpdated

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graph.Communications.Calls.ICall.ChangeScreenSharingRoleAsync(Microsoft.Graph.ScreenSharingRole,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Changes own sharing role in a vbss session.
member.returns: The that completes after the request has been sent.

member.summary: Unmutes the self participant asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graph.Communications.Calls.ICall.UpdateRecordingStatusAsync(Microsoft.Graph.RecordingStatus,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Updates the recording status of the bot. Currently only applicable to Compliance Recording bots.
member.returns: The that completes after the request has been sent.

member.summary: Records a short audio clip from the call.
member.param: Max duration for a record operation before stopping recording. Default = 5 minutes (300 seconds)
Time to wait for user to start speaking for the first time before timing out. If the timeout is reached the recorder will abort the operation. Default = 5 sec
Maximum silence (pause) time allowed after a user has started speaking. If the timeout is reached the record operation will be aborted. Default = 5 sec
Optional Boolean flag to determines if the request should be queued up or barge into existing requests. Default = false
If true, plays a beep to indicate to the user that they can start recording their message. Default = true
Collection of type MediaPrompt to play (if any) before recording starts.
DTMF characters that can be specified to indicate record is complete.
member.returns: See with information on how the record operation completed.
member.remarks: Not intended to record the entire call asynchronously; the maximum length of recording is five minutes (300 seconds).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graph.Communications.Calls.ICall.DeleteAsync(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes this call asynchronously.
member.param: If the is already gone, whether to handle the exception gracefully or not.
member.returns: The that completes after the request has been sent. The completion of this task does not guarantee deletion. Confirmation of deletion comes as a notification and can be subscribed by ICall.OnUpdated and ICallCollection.OnUpdated
